original_title: Sri Lanka rupee at 308.30/310 to US dollar at close, bond yields up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka bonds were up at close and t-bills were down, dealers said while the spot ended at 308.30/310 rupees to the US dollar.
Bond markets were quiet without active firm quotes in the morning shortly after opening. A Treasury bill auction is to be held on Tuesday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 24.00/75 percent, up from 23.26/24.25 percent on Monday.
A bond maturing on 01.07.20225 was closed at 27.30/28.00 percent up from 27.25/28.25 percent on Monday.
Three-months maturing bill closed at 22.30/23.00 down from last close at 22.75/23.25 percent. (Colombo/ June 27/2023)
